metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9689 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
content/renderer/device_sensors/device_orientation_event_pump.cc in Google Chrome before 41.0.2272.76 does not properly restrict access to high-rate gyroscope data, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain speech signals from a device's physical environment via a crafted web site that listens for ondeviceorientation events, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-1231.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9689` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-browser-l10n - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-chromedriver - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
No subscription required

notes.Note: chrisccoulson> No sensor backend in Oxide with which to exploit this

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076').
